pros: - The people: we work with incredibly passionate, driven humans who strive to make a difference in our community - The resources: WCMHS provides tons of ongoing training opportunities, with a dedicated training department and regular check ins - The management: Management is incredible supportive and open to new ideas Coming to work every day knowing that what we do has a meaningful impact in the community is beyond rewarding. Having coworkers, managers and peers who are aligned on this mission cultivates a wonderful work environment.
cons: - Salary: Wages are pretty standard for the area. We work in non profit, it is what it is!

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Barre, VT
pros: Transparency from directors, collaborative problem solving, training and professional development opportunities, incredible colleagues and feeling like you as an individual are valued by the agency
cons: Staff shortages/outages and having to cover outside your role Tedious paperwork responsibilities that could be streamlined

pros: Best benefits package of all area agencies. HR does a great job making you feel welcome and fit the the role.
cons: All agencies have the same cons as they have to abide by state laws.

job_title: Chief Financial Officer in South Barre, VT
pros: I have never worked for a company that has a more positive or inclusive culture. Even when remote work is an option, most employees choose to come into the office to be around fellow employees, work in teams, get help with challenges and to share life events. And this comes from the top down - led by our compassionate, effervescent, Executive Director Mary Moulton.
cons: The work, especially for the majority of jobs which are direct care, can be difficult. From working with a client who is having a difficult day to being present to hear about their trauma, abuse, or neglect. Pay used to be low, but WCMHS has been agressively seeking new funding and rates have increased substantially. Benefits are on par with any top employer in the country.

job_title: Director of Children Youth Family Services in Barre, VT
pros: Amazing CEO who is super knowledgeable, approachable, and incredibly hard working. Leadership is diverse and mutually supportive. The agency clearly goes the extra mile for our clients and recognizes the unique needs of our community members and ensures our services are as unique and individualized as possible.
cons: The work is challenging, staffing shortages makes that work harder, we have lots of areas for growth, but those areas are really focused on operational improvements - our teams, our staff, our vision, and the energy with which we do our work is absolutely excellent.

pros:
Accommodating
Fair
Fun work environment
Caring Co-workers
cons: I honestly can't think of any

review_title: great place to start out your career
pros: ease of scheduling clients, freedom to have time to take care of personal needs and comp time. Unique culture
cons: Administration heavy and sometimes difficulty finding the right person to answer questions.

pros: Washington county has been very welcoming and supportive of me. They offer flexibility when needed.
cons: I would love to see better pay in the mental health field in general but I know WCMHS is doing their best to improve this!

pros: Great clients and several co-workers who were well-intentioned and respectful of clients. I honestly can’t say another positive thing about my experience with this county. However, there are many programs under this county’s umbrella, and I am sure that there are many better programs.
cons: The most dysfunctional environment I have ever worked in. The supervisor was rarely at work and was deeply unethical and inappropriate. The atmosphere was bizarre, gossipy and cruel. Clients were mocked at staff meetings. During individual supervision and informal staff gatherings, the supervisor mocked other staff members, as well as her former supervisor, who had been promoted.  The clients were far healthier than the staff members. Neither the upper management  nor HR were open to reports about what was going on. Staff were routinely fired. I have worked in the mental health field for 17 years, and have never seen the likes of this. I would never work for this county again.

pros: progressive and cutting edge program options, culture of collaboration, intelligent and creative staff, flexible hours, excellent and inexpensive benefits and time off, rewarding work, opportunities for changing positions and challenging assignments, residential and office based jobs available throughout the agency
cons: pay is less than competing companies in the area, its difficult to recruit and retain skilled staff such as nurses, multiple job sites make travelling around Barre and Montpelier necessary but the nature of the work makes this a requirement

review_title: Great learning opportunity for young professionals
pros: Helpful support from supervisors, counselors, and school staff. The BI team was supportive and willing to lend a hand or an ear, when involved in weekly group meetings. Lots of training opportunities available.
cons: Being at a school site, I felt a little disconnected from the base. I didn't receive a lot of training at the beginning. This is suited for someone who can work very independently and feels confident in providing one-on-one services.

pros: Some lovely co workers who were really in it for the right reasons.
cons: Low salary and low quality, high cost health benefits, although not totally their fault, this is partially just the landscape of insurance these days, but for the amount taken out of our pay with low pay to begin with the outrageously high deductibles were debilitating.

review_title: The Best Employer I've worked for.
pros: Generous paid time off, great benefit package overall. Supervisor gives us the latitude to our jobs well. Work truly feels like it's being done to make a difference in the community.
cons: Pay can be a squeeze, but that's non-profit healthcare.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in South Barre, VT
pros: The company provides great benefits! The people are great to work with and the CEO is very involved with the company.
cons: The pay is not great but it’s a nonprofit so that’s to be expected.

pros: Paid mileage, generous time off and a fun summer program.
cons: The pay is just okay, lots of gossip, belittling supervisors, job can be violent at times, having to restrain violent children.

pros: Very supportive management and client's well being is key.
cons: Rely on formal education vs. life experiences.
